output_list.description: The mintToken function has an integer overflow in the calculation of totalSupply, allowing the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The mintToken function has a wrong logic in the calculation of totalSupply, allowing the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The mintToken function has a typo in the constructor, allowing an arbitrary user to claim ownership and funds.
The mintToken function has a denial of service issue, allowing an attacker to claim ownership and funds.
The mintToken function has bad randomness, allowing an attacker to predict the minted value.
